Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Mr. Yaniv Meirov, Exec. Dir. Chazaq, 141-24 Jewel Ave., Flushing N.Y. 11367.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Lancman.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Mr. Yaniv Meirov, Executive Director Chazaq, 141-24 Jewel Avenue, Flushing, N.Y. 11367.

Council Member Lancman moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 6, 2017 and June 21, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Treyger.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Treyger moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 6, 2017 and June 21, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Mario Gooden to the Council for its advice and consent in anticipation of his appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Mario Gooden,  Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Anne Holford-Smith to the Council for its advice and consent in anticipation of her appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Anne Holford-Smith,  Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Communication from the City Council – Recalling Introduction number 1648-A, in relation to establishing an office of nightlife and a nightlife advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Recalling Introduction number 1648-A, Establishing an office of nightlife and a nightlife advisory board.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Rodriguez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 4325-4327 Broadway (at the corner of West 184th Street), Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 12, Application No. 20175504 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 4325-4327 Broadway, Manhattan (20175504 TCM)

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the Charlottesville Neo-Nazi Rally, and calling upon President Donald J. Trump to swiftly, unequivocally and consistently denounce such actions and ideologies, and direct funding to organizations working to counter far-right extremism.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Deputy Majority Leader (Council Member Gentile) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Condemning the Charlottesville Neo-Nazi Rally, and calling upon President Trump to swiftly, unequivocally and consistently denounce such actions and ideologies, and direct funding to organizations working to counter far-right extremism.
